intro: Gilia densifolia, commonly known as the denseleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Phlox family (Polemoniaceae) and is characterized by its dense, foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Gilia densifolia is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important part of local ecosystems.
